title: Saturday Studio: Word as Image—Bochner-Inspired Portraits (Aug 13)
title_display: Saturday Studio: Word as Image—Bochner-Inspired Portraits
hero_caption: Mel Bochner. Portrait of Eva Hesse (detail) 1966. Collection of the artist. Image © Mel Bochner. Photo by Nicholas Knight.
short_description: Drop in to Saturday Studio and create a self-portrait inspired by the text-based work of Mel Bochner.
list_description: Drop in to Saturday Studio and create a self-portrait inspired by the text-based work of Mel Bochner.
description:
Drop in to Saturday Studio at the Art Institute this summer to explore art-making experiences led by Chicago-based artists! All experience levels and ages are welcome, and materials will be provided.

In this session of Saturday Studio, participants will create unconventional self-portraits inspired by the text-based work of artist Mel Bochner. Led by Chicago-based artist and educator Danielle Wright, participants will work with a thesaurus to select words that are intuitive and personal and then use their chosen words to compose a portrait that plays with type, repetition, color, and shape on paper. This event takes place in Mel Bochner Drawings: A Retrospective and is first-come, first-served based on available supplies.

Danielle Wright is a visual artist and educator engaged in serious play. She lives and works in Chicago, IL.
